items.preText: 7.37pm We're moments away from the chase. The Bangladesh boys have been doing fielding drills for the past 15 minutes. And out come Rohit and Dhawan. The captain will take strike against Mehidy. Vikram: "The surprising part is through out the tournament no one ever missed Kohli. Team always performs good when the team depends on itself rather than on an individual. " 7.28pm Ravish: "Any thoughts on the wicket? Ball not coming on nicely as it did towards the beginning of the game and all that fun stuff? " -- Not much turn for finger spinners, so Mehidy may not be too effective turn-wise. The ball is expected to come on better now that the sun has set. How the pitch will behave, though, is yet to be seen. Amit: "Tigers need to roar in the field. So far we fought with whatever we have in this tournament. This is the time to shine. Test indian middle order. Get the Hitman out early along with Mr. Kabaddi king :) . its not an easy wicket. Hoping for a competition" Nikhil: "I am nervous to see Rohit face the Fizz - Any movement in the air in the first few overs is going to trouble him, of course till the first 20 balls!" Srinivasan: "Lets not have a premature celebration like the opposition team. Lets finish it first. I was expecting at least 280 after the great start BD had. Runs on the board are always tricky. " Sid: "Simple template for Bangladesh. Do not DROP Rohit. He will make you pay like no other batsman. " 7.15pm We're in early for the second innings, so let your thoughts keep coming in. India fans, walk in the park? Surely not, right? As for Bangladesh, the template is clear: keep taking wickets every 5-6 overs. Prakhar Saxena: "If our openers do not perform today and our middle led by karthik and raydu fails to chase the target, we need to get out of the notion that we will play rahul only in the opening alot. We are wasting a talent like rahul as we have done in past with many players. Its disheartening to see rahul on the bench." AnamBMDF: "A postmortem summary report from a BD fan: The plan of new opening pair and respecting regular bowlers resulted good start during 1st 20 overs: 120 without losing a wicket, helping maiden century for Liton (Congrats). But the plan to attack Kuldeep & others delivering lots of full toss and loose balls resulted poor shots, tensing 3 run outs and losing all 10 wickets in last 30 overs for 100 runs! So, the final suggestion: Make Rohit and Dhawan out in initial 5 overs and win the match. " Venkata Mantrav: "India played well and have higher chances but "It ain't over until its over". So don't start celebrating yet." Pradeepta: "Guys: Cups are earned not gifted for the efforts. In that case England should have been gifted world cup long time agao. BD has to learn from their mistakes, improve, and then only win a cup. India went through the heart breaks of 87 & 96 semi-finals and 2003 final to earn another world cup in 2011."
items.text: full on his pads, and flicked off his toes to deep backward square leg to get India's innings off the mark
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: length ball, but too wide outside off. Picks the length early, and slaps this square past point for the innings' first boundary!
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, FOUR runs

items.text: back of a length outside off again. Spinning away from the batsman, as he flat-bats a shot down to long off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, 1 run

items.preText: Mehidy Hasan is the first Bangladesh player to open the innings with both bat and ball in ODI cricket
items.text: length ball angling inwards, and that's been whipped off his pads past the fielder at square leg! Pure placement, played with gentle hands
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, FOUR runs

items.text: good length on middle, and spinning down leg. Rohit swivels and pulls along the ground, but the shot finds Rubel at square leg
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

items.text: too short from Mehidy. Half-tracker spinning inwards, and he nudges a shot off the back foot to square leg. Wants the single, but Dhawan says no
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

items.preText: AG: "Mehidy opening for Bangladesh with both the bat and ball in this game. Manoj Prabhakar immediately comes to mind when I think of cricketers who opened for their team with bat and ball. Any others?" -- Mohammad Hafeez and Tilakaratne Dilshan appear on that list a lot. Here's the full list.
items.text: good length just outside off, and pushed off the back foot to cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, no run

items.text: good length on the fourth-stump line outside off. Firmly blocked off the front foot to cover
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, no run

items.text: full on off, but angling into his pads. Clipped away - off his legs - to the fielder at deep backward square. Soumya Sarkar cleans up
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, 2 runs

items.text: good length just outside off, and angling in after pitching. Dhawan prods forward to defend, but the ball hits his back leg. Appeal for lbw in unison but the umpire shakes his head. They consider reviewing, but eventually don't. Too high anyway
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, no run

items.text: full just outside off, and he tentatively pushes off the front foot. The bat turns in his hands and trickles back to The Fizz
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, no run

items.text: good length, but wide outside off stump. Dhawan chooses not to play at it, and the ball goes into the keeper's gloves
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, no run

items.text: back of a length on middle, but spinning into Rohit's pads. Misses the flick, and hits his front leg. Big appeal for lbw but not given. Would've definitely gone down leg stump
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

items.text: full just outside off, and defended off the front foot
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

items.text: good length on leg stump, and spinning further down leg. Rohit has no trouble in opening his stance, and then swats a pull past the fielder at square leg for another leg-side boundary!
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, FOUR runs

items.text: length ball on off, and turning in. Punched off the back foot to mid on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, no run

items.text: tossed up on middle and leg. Rohit clears his back leg, and drives down the ground to mid on
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: length ball outside off, and angling into the left-hander. He rocks back to punch towards mid off
items.shortText: Mehidy Hasan Miraz to Dhawan, no run

items.text: full on middle, and Rohit drives with the angled bat towards midwicket. Struck well, and the infielder must give it a chase
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, 2 runs

items.text: good length just outside leg stump. Straightens after pitching and hits his front leg! Big appeal for lbw again but not given. Clearly pitching outside the stumps
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, no run

items.text: full on middle, and tentatively defended towards the leg side for a single. They scamper across for one
items.postText: Rahul: "For some reason, Neil Johnson comes to my mind more than anyone else! From that list, Sehwag was the last Indian to do so, more than 15 years back!"
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Sharma, 1 run

items.text: full and wide outside off stump. Allows Dhawan to clear his arms, and he caresses a square drive through the infield! Races away as the crowd goes ballistic
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, FOUR runs

items.text: full just outside off stump. Fended
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, no run

items.preText: Len: "Frank worrell of west indies missing in the list of opening batsman and bowler." -- he never played ODI cricket!
items.text: full just outside off once again. Leans forward to defend towards cover and see the over out
items.shortText: Mustafizur Rahman to Dhawan, no run

items.text: half-tracker on off, and he pulls this over mid on. Enough legs to clear the boundary as the batsman share some glove love. Too easy, too loose
items.shortText: Nazmul Islam to Sharma, SIX runs
